title: US Senate Youth - old english style
content:
I’m terrible at identifying this style of fonts. Maybe someone here recognizes it.

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [usyouth.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065022/http:/typophile.com/files/usyouth.gif) | 20.04 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
How old is this sample? Where is it from?

- Lex

not like that but close, I like it  
 [http://simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/uechi\_gothic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065022/http:/simplythebest.net/fonts/fonts/uechi_gothic.html)

Regards,  
AS

[http://hearstfdn.org/ussyp/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065022/http:/hearstfdn.org/ussyp/)

pdf at website uses bmp, not vector version of font

Not sure of age.

Magdeburg has a very similar feel but it’s more delicate.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/magdeburg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065022/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/magdeburg/)

It’s Bastarda style, judging from the shape of the ‘o’, and the closest style in general form (not details) that I could find was Washington Text (see [http://bowfinprintworks.com/Script03Pg5.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604065022/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script03Pg5.html)). The ‘a’ is also not a very typical blackletter shape.

It would be my guess that this is custom lettering or a custom font, and not something commercially available. It looks very professional, whatever it is.

- Mike Yanega
Magdeburg is the most similar, thank you pattyfab.
